text: There is default hs module for social share. Please try that
Looks really slick, nice work Chad. I like the subtle animations to the background icons, nice touch :ok_hand:

A question, mostly for me, the buttons across your homepage aren't using HubSpot CTAs, is there a reason you went with plain HTML buttons over CTAs? (for context, my team own CTAs and we know that there's a lot of work to do, we're trying to understand where we can provide more value in the tool, hence questions like this)
Which one are you in the “Who we are” section :wink:
HS Devs - question - is there a query parameter or javascript variable used to toggle the new nav bar? Feel free to DM and I’ll explain why I’m wondering
This is slick! Awesome job on it!

<@UAZCZ3HMW> there are many solutions out there such as ShareThis and AddThis that can offer this style, as <@UAUL7RBPY> also mentioned, HubSpot has a default module that can be a basic social share button style. If you are looking to roll your own based on the above graphic, you would have to look at the developer resources for those social sites and use a custom module to bring it all together.

May have encountered a small bug with the File Manager. We moved a folder containing images into another for better internal organization, however, all those images are now wiped out. Easy enough to re-upload the images to the folder, but its a bit disconcerting when we're using those images in modules / hubdb columns.

It appears you guys are loading the new nav server side. It’s not already in the page.

Was looking for a way to enable it for an individual user via css or JS, without enabling for the whole team. 

All I was able to figure out is how I could possibly make it opt in without providing accurate information about who opted in.
<!here> New channel alert: <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript> for all your Javascript related questions and answers!
Has there been given any official timeline for Smart Content in the new Custom Modules?

Hello! I am in design manager setting up a logo image to point to a URL (homepage) and I noticed that the image properties has a new value called 'Open link in new tab'. By default, it is disabled, but regardless of your selection it will for the anchor's target attribute to render "true" or "false" resulting in a new tab to always open. Does anyone know how new this feature might be? Maybe possible rollback? Thanks,
IF I’m understanding you correct you’re saying it’s litterally outputting `target="true"` instead of` target=“_blank”`?
<@U7SL518D6> Correct, if you toggle the value it just renders either true or false

<@U6GNQ7JBU> - not sure that this is at all your dept. seems like an easy fix though to just change the output of the default logo module
```pseudo code:
{%if new_tab%}target="_blank"{%endif%}```
